Class MagnonPhononCoupling

java.lang.Object
org.jscience.apps.physics.spintronics.MagnonPhononCoupling
public class MagnonPhononCoupling extends Object
Magnon-Phonon Coupling simulation for hybrid spin-lattice dynamics.

Magnons (spin waves) and phonons (lattice vibrations) interact through magnetoelastic coupling, enabling:

  • Spin-lattice relaxation
  • Acoustic spin pumping
  • Magnon-polaron formation
  • Surface acoustic wave (SAW) driven magnetization dynamics

Coupled Equations

The magnon-phonon Hamiltonian includes: $$ H_{mp} = \sum_k \hbar\omega_k^m a_k^\dagger a_k + \sum_q \hbar\omega_q^p b_q^\dagger b_q + \sum_{k,q} g_{kq}(a_k^\dagger b_q + a_k b_q^\dagger) $$

References

  • Kittel, C. (1958). "Interaction of spin waves and ultrasonic waves". Physical Review, 110(3), 836.
  • An, K. et al. (2020). "Coherent long-range transfer of angular momentum". Physical Review B, 101(6), 060407.
Since:
1.0
Author:
Silvere Martin-Michiellot, Gemini AI (Google DeepMind)

  • Constructor Details

    • MagnonPhononCoupling

      public MagnonPhononCoupling(Real b1, Real b2, Real c11, Real c44, Real density, Real ms, Real aEx, int numModes)
      Creates a magnon-phonon coupling simulator.
      Parameters:
      b1 - First magnetoelastic constant B1 (J/m³)
      b2 - Second magnetoelastic constant B2 (J/m³)
      c11 - Longitudinal elastic constant (Pa)
      c44 - Shear elastic constant (Pa)
      density - Mass density (kg/m³)
      ms - Saturation magnetization (A/m)
      aEx - Exchange stiffness (J/m)
      numModes - Number of k-space modes to simulate

  • Method Details

    • exciteMagnons

      public void exciteMagnons(int centerMode, double amplitude, double width)
      Excites magnon modes with a delta function pulse.
      Parameters:
      centerMode - Mode index to excite
      amplitude - Excitation amplitude
      width - Gaussian width

    • excitePhonons

      public void excitePhonons(double frequency, double amplitude)
      Excites phonon modes (e.g., via SAW transducer).
      Parameters:
      frequency - SAW frequency (Hz)
      amplitude - Displacement amplitude

    • evolve

      public void evolve(Real dt, Real magnonDamping, Real phononDamping)
      Evolves the coupled magnon-phonon system for one time step. Uses coupled oscillator equations with damping.
      Parameters:
      dt - Time step (s)
      magnonDamping - Magnon Gilbert damping parameter
      phononDamping - Phonon damping rate (1/s)

    • calculateMagnonEnergy

      public Real calculateMagnonEnergy()
      Calculates total magnon energy in the system.
      Returns:
      Magnon energy (J)

    • calculatePhononEnergy

      public Real calculatePhononEnergy()
      Calculates total phonon energy in the system.
      Returns:
      Phonon energy (J)

    • findAnticrossings

      public List<double[]> findAnticrossings()
      Finds anticrossing (level repulsion) between magnon and phonon modes.
      Returns:
      List of (mode index, coupling gap) pairs

    • calculateHybridization

      public Real calculateHybridization(int modeIndex)
      Calculates the magnon-polaron hybridization at a specific mode.
      Parameters:
      modeIndex - Mode index
      Returns:
      Hybridization coefficient (0 = pure magnon, 1 = pure phonon, 0.5 = maximum hybridization)

    • simulateSAWFMR

      public List<Real> simulateSAWFMR(double sawFrequency, double sawAmplitude, Real duration, Real dt)
      Simulates SAW-driven ferromagnetic resonance.
      Parameters:
      sawFrequency - SAW driving frequency (Hz)
      sawAmplitude - SAW strain amplitude
      duration - Simulation duration (s)
      dt - Time step (s)
      Returns:
      Time series of absorbed power

    • getMagnonAmplitudes

      public double[] getMagnonAmplitudes()

    • getPhononAmplitudes

      public double[] getPhononAmplitudes()

      public double[] getMagnonFrequencies()

    • getPhononFrequencies

      public double[] getPhononFrequencies()

    • createYIG

      public static MagnonPhononCoupling createYIG(int numModes)
      Creates a YIG (Yttrium Iron Garnet) magnon-phonon system. YIG has exceptionally low magnon damping.

    • createPermalloy

      public static MagnonPhononCoupling createPermalloy(int numModes)
      Creates a Permalloy (Ni80Fe20) magnon-phonon system.

    • createCobalt

      public static MagnonPhononCoupling createCobalt(int numModes)
      Creates a Cobalt magnon-phonon system.
